etymologies: late Middle English: via late Latin from Greek asteriskos ‘small star’, diminutive of astēr

notes.text: Even though asterisk does not look like a tricky word to pronounce, it can be problematic. In both its singular and plural forms, it is often mispronounced as if it ends with -rix. Pronounced correctly, it ends with a -risk sound when singular and -risks when plural

definitions: a symbol (*) used to mark printed or written text, typically as a reference to an annotation or to stand for omitted matter.
shortDefinitions: symbol (*) used in text as pointer to annotation or footnote

notes.text: Even though asterisk does not look like a tricky word to pronounce, it can be problematic. In both its singular and plural forms, it is often mispronounced as if it ends with -rix. Pronounced correctly, it ends with a -risk sound when singular and -risks when plural

definitions: mark (a word or piece of text) with an asterisk

examples.text: he had asterisked the things about the case that still bothered him

shortDefinitions: mark word or piece of text with asterisk
